Key Match Events: The Diamondbacks scored three runs in the eighth inning off Craig Kimbrel to stun the Phillies in Game 4, tying the series 2-2.
Game 4 was a bullpen game, with both teams using eight pitchers.
Pre-Game Insights: Game 5 of the NLCS at Chase Field on Saturday will give one of these teams a huge leg up in the series.
Zack Wheeler will start for the Phillies and Zac Gallen for the Diamondbacks in Game 5.
In Game 1, Zack Wheeler struck out eight with no walks in his six innings, allowing only a two-run home run by Geraldo Perdomo in the sixth inning.
Zac Gallen allowed three solo home runs in the first two innings of Game 1 and left after five innings trailing 5-0.
The D-backs are undefeated at home this season, winning all three games at Chase Field in addition to their 4-2 road record.
